Guidelines

A guide for the generic humanoid carbon unit

In order to make the Devcharm lists informative and fun to use and write we have prepared a set of easy guidelines to follow for the benefit of writers and readers alike!

  1. The title is the key - make it short (no more than 50 characters) and informative.

  2. The punchline - think Twitter! 140 characters and fun.

  3. The description - tell us what your list is about, why you decided to write it and what is your personal view on the topic. Try to stay below 500 characters.

  4. The list item - please keep the link part short: one, two words. Every link needs a comprehensive description, telling the reader what will s/he find on the website/resource and why do you find it useful and relevant to the topic. Make it interesting and make it under 250 characters.

  5. Sections - you might find it useful to divide your list into sections that help the reader to find the relevant information quickly and to maintain the flow of the list.

  6. Some general stuff - a list should reflect your view on the topic, what you consider important and valuable and it should contain at least 5 links. Also, remember to keep the links connected and relevant - imagine a Devcharm list as an article on a specific topic. And last but not least: please spell check!

  7. Spread the word!

Thank you!
